name: gusplease
text: For fun, I like to guess which, if any, particular nationally syndicated political cartoon or cartoons Onstad had in mind while writing this one.

name: zem
text: So what have you come up with

name: gusplease
text: All of them.

name: arcibi
text: ba dum pssh

name: bemyfamily
text: I had to perform this onomatopoeia out loud to realize how perfect it was. Well done.

name: mr_pete
text: Most successful political comedy is only taking the easy buckets.

name: saint
text:
i think he means the cardboard box is empty. not his efforts. I could be wrong.

I am wrong. It was an observation.

name: spinynorman
text:
Lyle's tender and thoughtful moments are hilarious.

Poor Darlene.

name: mortshire
text: i hope mike peters wakes up to this feeling every day.

name: leon_sumbitches
text: I agree with the last frame. It is just TOO easy to make fun of the Bush family.

name: linning
text:
I know right? It's not that the jokes are less funny or accurate, it's just that they are things that everybody knows.

Still, he does look like a chimp.

name: aperson
text: Wait. Did you just compare the president to a chimp ?

name: dri-ft
text: The bracers in the last panel make it.

name: rowboat
text: Lends it a sort of Raging Bull quality.

name: oishii
text:
Only slightly distasteful:

http://www.liveleak.com/view?i=ca9_1174228123

name: closefriend
text:
Onstad's (rightfully) upset that other "cartoonists" are put on equal ground with him... even though all you need to do to make a political cartoon is...

1. Draw the earth.
2. Draw a lit fuse sticking out.
3. Label the earth after something you don't like.

Yes, the world is an old-timey time bomb named after Napster/Enron/Exxon Valdez/Ron Paul/Gas Prices/Muslims. Once again science has failed us.

name: sortelli
text: I'm pretty shocked that your mention of Ron Paul hasn't drawn a lot of Ron Paul spam.

name: molesticide
text: motherfucker do not mention ron paul twice in one comment you son of a BITCH

text: speak of the ron paul

ron paul ron paul

name: arbys
text: I wonder if Lyle is referring to Millie from "Ozy and Millie", the webcomic (which had already been around for several years when Achewood started). Hurm.

name: endoftheworld
text: I believe "Millie" is a reference to George Bush Sr.'s pet dog.

name: sortelli
text: I know you are right but I like the original idea better because the person who does Ozy and Millie is also a hack political cartoonist.

name: nucleargeranium
text: Oh, it is so true.

name: coco
text: God, I love the contrast between tv box Lyle and staring-in-the-mirror Lyle . . .

name: hamscout
text: I gave this a 3, because the third panel conjured up a Lyle/Larry King composite that made me shiver...

name: kickstart
text:
re: the alt-text
I was trying to figure out what this strip had to do with Deadwood (Lyle looks a bit like Swearingen in the last panel?) and then I realized that the program hadn't even come out yet in 1/2002. I guess 'deadwood' in this case just means actual dead wood?

name: tonyhighwind
text: I am giving this a five for truth.

text: I"M CUMMING
